bug.summary: DenoisingTask object has no attribute build_dataset_for_inference
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior (always include the command you ran): When I run the code below, an error raises that AttributeError: 'DenoisingTask' object has no attribute 'build_dataset_for_inference' <denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>import torch bart = torch.hub.load('pytorch/fairseq', 'bart.large') bart.sample(['Hello world!']) </denchmark-code>

comments.comment:
I got the same error while trying to reproduce the xsum results. The default task when you initialize Bart is DenoisingTask. I was able to solve this problem by downloading the model weights and manually initializing the model as following: <denchmark-code>import torch from fairseq.models.bart import BARTModel
bart = BARTModel.from_pretrained( /path/to/bart.large/ checkpoint_file='model.pt', data_name_or_path=/path/to/datadir/, task='translation' ) </denchmark-code>
I get the same error if I don't set task='translation'.

I've found a somehow hacking way: <denchmark-code>import torch bart = torch.hub.load('pytorch/fairseq', 'bart.large') foo = torch.hub.load(...) # any translation task bart.task.build_dataset_for_inference = foo.task.build_dataset_for_inference bart.sample(['Hello world!']) </denchmark-code>
Seems it works...
A bit late for the party. This can be easily solved by adding the missing method to the denoising task from any translation task. I hacked the source code and re-compiled without any problems.
